azurerm_image.description: Manages a custom virtual machine image that can be used to create virtual machines.

name.description: Specifies the name of the image. Changing this forces a

resource_group_name.description: The name of the resource group in which to create

location.description: Specified the supported Azure location where the resource exists.

source_virtual_machine_id.description: The Virtual Machine ID from which to create the image.

os_disk.description: One or more `os_disk` elements as defined below.

data_disk.description: One or more `data_disk` elements as defined below.

tags.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

zone_resilient.description: Is zone resiliency enabled?  Defaults to `false`.  Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

hyper_v_generation.description: The HyperVGenerationType of the VirtualMachine created from the image as `V1`, `V2`. The default is `V1`.

os_type.description: Specifies the type of operating system contained in the virtual machine image. Possible values are: Windows or Linux.

os_state.description: Specifies the state of the operating system contained in the blob. Currently, the only value is Generalized.

managed_disk_id.description: Specifies the ID of the managed disk resource that you want to use to create the image.

blob_uri.description: Specifies the URI in Azure storage of the blob that you want to use to create the image.

caching.description: Specifies the caching mode as `ReadWrite`, `ReadOnly`, or `None`. The default is `None`.

size_gb.description: Specifies the size of the image to be created. The target size can't be smaller than the source size.

lun.description: Specifies the logical unit number of the data disk.
